name: 勞維俊
objective: 透過細讀虛構的作品與觀察現實中的建築與城市風景，學生將學習檢視城市的不同風貌。本課程旨在培養學生將自身對城市的感受化為文字，並加以分析批判。除了口頭報告和書面作業，課程將要求學生以英文製作一部有關城市的短片。如有機會，將安排學生實地考察台北或其他城市。
schedule:
Course Aims:

Students will examine different features of a city including architecture and urbanscape represented in both works of fiction and in reality. This course aims to train students’ abilities to transform their experiences in the city into words and other media, and to analyze aspects of the city critically. Apart from presentations and written assignments, students are required to make a short film in English about the city. A field trip to parts of Taipei or other cities may be arranged.

The Skywalk Is Gone (2002) (short film) (dir. Tsai Ming-liang)

Week 7-8: St. Petersburg

Week 9: Mid-term Examination 

III: Sexuality and the City

Week 10: Conference (No class) – Wong Kai-wai’s Happy Together screening

Week 11: On Happy Together

Week 12-13: Georg Simmel, ‘The Metropolis and Mental Life’

IV. Walking the City


Week 14-15: Michel de Certeau, ‘Walking in the City’ 
[Week 15: short film shooting plan due]

Week 16: Field trip (sites in Taipei – details to be announced)

Week 17: Presentation of shot films

Week 18: Final Examination
scorePolicy:
Teaching Approach

Students are required to read all the assigned texts, including literary, filmic and theoretical works. They should attend field trips and lectures, participate in discussions in tutorials, write an essay, and give a presentation or make a short film.

Assessment

Participation  　　　　　　　　　　　　10%
Presentation / Short film production　　30%
Mid-term examination　　　　　　　　30%
Final essay　　　　　　　　　　　　30%    
　　　　　　　　　　　　　　      100%
